page.title: 07Farming activity
page.content: Before 1975, the combined acreage of{Moulton Lodge and North Farm}was devoted to the production of vegetables and cereal crops.In addition a herd of 180 cows was kept for milk production.At this time, five men were employed. 1975 saw the replacement of the dairy herd by 100 head of beef cattle which along with the arable, employed three men.Since 1979, the land has been{entirely arable}growing wheat, barley, oats and oil-seed rape. Increasing mechanisation has resulted in the farm using{fewer full time {workers}but with a much greater level of productivity. In addition to the farm owner, one full-time worker is employed and he earns{Â£145}per week.A part-time worker is taken on during July, August and September.
